title: Russia will abandon Soyuz on orbit, fly up a new one to bring crew home
summary: The temperature inside the vehicle could reach the low 40s Celsius during Earth return.

title: Rocket builder ABL’s inaugural launch fails shortly after liftoff, damages launchpad
summary: The first mission by ABL Space got off the ground on Tuesday, but the company’s RS1 rocket suffered an issue early in the flight that caused it to fail shortly after lifting off.

title: Roscosmos to launch uncrewed Soyuz to replace damaged spacecraft at ISS
summary: Russia will launch a Soyuz spacecraft without a crew to the International Space Station in February after concluding a damaged Soyuz spacecraft docked there cannot safely return its crew to Earth.

title: SpaceX flexes might with simultaneous Starship, Falcon 9, Falcon Heavy, Dragon operations
summary: On January 9th, SpaceX demonstrated the breadth of its capabilities by simultaneously operating two orbital Dragons, four rockets, and four launch pads....

title: NOAA might revise geostationary weather satellite timeline
summary: High demand for space weather data is prompting the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to consider revising the schedule for its next geostationary weather satellite constellation.

title: SpaceX stacks Starship and Super Heavy booster for “wet dress rehearsal” test
summary: For the third time in three months, SpaceX has fully assembled Starship 24 and Super Heavy Booster 7 after another period of...

title: CAES Space Systems becomes Frontgrade Technologies
summary: CAES Space Systems, a supplier of radiation-hardened electronics, rebranded as Frontgrade Technologies Jan. 10 after being sold to private equity firm Veritas Capital.

title: Full steam ahead for NOAA’s $20 billion GeoXO program
summary: The $19.6 billion budget for the GeoXO program, approved in December, covers six satellites, operations and support extending from 2022 to 2052.

title: airBaltic will equip its fleet with Starlink

title: Geospatial industry investor Keith Masback joins board of directors of Cognitive Space
summary: Cognitive Space announced Jan. 10 the appointment of Keith Masback as an independent board member.
